Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 13, mean = 58, sd = 8.07 Sample 2: n = 18, mean = 50, sd = 3.46. The pooled variance estimator takes the value of 33.97. It is tested Whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* A T distribution with 31 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 29 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 13 and 18 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 12 and 17 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 31 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 29 degrees of freedom: Correct
* An F-division with 13 and 18 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 12 and 17 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
